description: A total immersion experience and capstone course for students completing the language
requirement.  This course integrates listening, speaking, reading, writing, and cultural
competence by exploring the recent history and contemporary aspects of major German
cities, especially Berlin. Students self-select immersion situations, keep a journal of
field experiences, and write short papers on topics from journal notes.  Taught in
German. May be counted toward the German major or German studies concentration.
Offered periodically during Interim. Open to first-year students. Prerequisite: GERM 231
fullname: Language and Culture Studies in Germany (abroad)
shortname: Lang and Culture Studies in Germany
